page.title: 07Health Services in Northill
page.content: There are no{medical}or{ancillary {services}in the village. Doctors, Dis- trict Nurses & Health Visitors from the Sandy or Biggleswade surgeries and health centres call on patients who are unable to make the journey them- selves. A mobile chiropodist visits senior citizens requesting treatment. {St. John's Hospice in Moggerhanger}is run by the{Sue Ryder Foundation. }The Hospice cares for the terminally ill, and depends financially on charitable donations and grants from the District Health Authorities. {Park Hospital,}currently under threat of closure, is a District Health Authority institution for those need- ing rehabilitation & physiotherapy at a general hospital. There is no{dental}practitioner in the area. Treatment can be obtained in the neighbouring towns.
